contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox protected area of Australia | name = Whitsunday Islands Island National Park | iucn_category = II | image = Whitsunday islands.jpg | caption = Whitehaven beach on Whitsunday Island | locator_x = | locator_y = | nearest_town_or_city = | coordinates = {{Coord|20|03|37|S|148|52|27|E|type:isle_region:AU|display=title}} | area = {{Convert|170|km2|sqmi|1|abbr=on}} | established = 1944 | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | managing_authorities = [[Queensland Parks and Wildlife Service]] | official_site = }} '''Whitsunday Islands''' is a [[national park]] in [[Queensland]], [[Australia]], {{Convert|920|km|mi}} northwest of [[Brisbane]]. ==Geography== The [[Whitsunday Islands]] lie midway along Australia's Queensland coast and are bordered by the [[Great Barrier Reef]] and the waters of the [[Coral Sea]]. Migrating [[humpback whale]]s favour the waters around the Whitsunday Islands as a calving ground between May and September each year.<ref name="xqnp">{{cite book |title=Explore Queensland's National Parks |year=2008 |publisher=Explore Australia Publishing |location=Prahran, Victoria |isbn=978-1-74117-245-4 |pages=19 }}</ref> [[Marine stinger]]s are found in the waters of the islands between October and May.<ref name="xqnp"/> The region spans from the beaches of [[Bowen, Queensland|Bowen]] in the north and Laguna Whitsundays in the south. All 74 of the islands are surrounded by the Great Barrier Reef and only eight them are inhabited. ==See also== {{Portal|Queensland}} * [[List of islands of Australia]] * [[Protected areas of Queensland]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{National Parks of Queensland}} [[Category:National parks of Queensland]] [[Category:Protected areas established in 1944]] [[Category:North Queensland]] {{Queensland-national-park-stub}}
